author: Sruthisagar Yamunan
text:
The AIADMK, on Tuesday, broke ranks with the Opposition in the Rajya Sabha and voted with the government on a Congress-led amendment moved to the President’s address regretting omission of a mention of laws passed by Rajasthan and Haryana prescribing educational qualification for those contesting in local body polls.

Despite the AIADMK’s backing, the amendment was passed with 94 in favour and 61 against.

The AIADMK has 12 MPs in the Upper House.

The decision to back the Modi government on the issues comes just weeks after the AIADMK regime in Tamil Nadu passed a historic law that reserved 50 per cent of local body positions to women.

Some leaders in the AIADMK claimed that some of the party MPs were a “little surprised” at the decision to go with the government on the issue though they followed the “directions” on the issue.
title: AIADMK votes with Modi govt.
